summary: This document is an email chain from November 2020 between prosecutors in the United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell case and a legal coordinator, discussing the scheduling of a call with a potential expert witness, Dr. Cooper, to testify about child victims of sexual abuse at the scheduled trial.

persons.name: Jan Johnson
persons.context: Acts as the coordinator for Developmental & Forensic Pediatrics, P.A., facilitating communication between prosecutors and Dr. Cooper regarding scheduling a call.

persons.name: Dr. Cooper
persons.context: A doctor with expertise in child victims of sexual abuse, whom prosecutors wish to call to explain specific terms and concepts at Ghislaine Maxwell's trial.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The accused in the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, referenced as the subject of the upcoming trial.

connections.description: Jan Johnson is coordinating scheduling and communication for Dr. Cooper as a potential expert witness.
Prosecutors are seeking to engage Dr. Cooper as an expert witness to testify on child sexual abuse concepts in the Ghislaine Maxwell trial.
Prosecutors are representing the United States in the criminal case against defendant Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Scheduled Trial Date for United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: The trial for Ghislaine Maxwell is scheduled to begin on July 12, 2021, in the Southern District of New York.

events.title: Email Coordination for Expert Witness Call
events.description: Email exchange to schedule a call between prosecutors and Dr. Cooper to discuss her potential testimony as an expert witness.

locations: One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: Prosecutors in the United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell case are seeking an expert witness, Dr. Cooper, to testify on concepts related to child victims of sexual abuse.
The trial for Ghislaine Maxwell was scheduled for July 12, 2021, in the Southern District of New York.
The prosecutors' practice is not to provide the expert with case information for an opinion on specific facts, but to have them explain general terms and concepts.
The email chain shows coordination efforts in late October and early November 2020 to schedule a call with the expert witness.
